title: Baron Greenhill
text:
Baron Greenhill, of <a href="Townhead">Townhead</a> in the City of <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, was a title in the <a href="Peerage%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">Peerage of the United Kingdom</a>. It was created on 8 July 1950 for <a href="Ernest%20Greenhill%2C%201st%20Baron%20Greenhill">Ernest Greenhill</a>, a former member of the <a href="Glasgow%20Corporation">Glasgow Corporation</a>. His elder son, the second Baron, was Professor of Community Medicine at the <a href="University%20of%20Alberta">University of Alberta</a> in <a href="Canada">Canada</a>. The third Baron, who succeeded in 1989, once worked for the <a href="UK%20Ministry%20of%20Defence">UK Ministry of Defence</a> as a <a href="patent%20attorney">patent attorney</a>. 
Barons Greenhill (1950).
On the death of the 3rd Baron on 13 January 2020, the barony became extinct.
